title: What I've learned from 2 banned accounts.
body:
1 Always mute all your teammates.
2 People legit play ranked to upset you and throw games, accept that you aren't allowed to play the game as design and take the non-consensual losses.
3 If at an elo where you are in the same skill as your opponent, jungle is rng. If they have the better jungle accept the loss and accept that you will waste your time playing out the lost game for 25 more minutes while try harding and still losing. Don't call that troll out because your whole team will instantly turn on you.
Do 1 to prevent 3.
4 Understand getting better at the game is a pipe dream, trolls, afks, and inters will prevent you from learning anything past the 8 minute marker.
5 4 also applies when the enemy team has the trolls, afks, and inters.
6 if muting people is a problem, don't spend rp, your accounts going to get banned, teammate will defend a troll before they will defend the person calling out the troll.
7 9 game loss streaks where you are the only person with a positive score and only turret kill on the map are common. Do not start swearing at people in game 7. This will get you punished. Please refer to rule 1
8 this is a team game where it benefits your team more to mute them then to communicate with them, because your team is bots. Sometimes you wish your team was bots, and every rare occasion you have a decent team. However in these cases the enemy team is bots and the game is over quickly. Don't ever expect a fun back and forth battle, these don't exist.
9 Get better at leveling accounts because I'll never resort to 1.

Sadly pre s7 I've never had a single mark against my account. Have always had friendly or helpful borders. These meta changes create such a lower environment for personal skill to show through, and I believe as that trend continues so will my behavior. It's unfortunate that I can see this and I struggle to fix the behavior, but this game's meta since mid S7 has really turned me from a friendly player to a resentful rng loot box teammate simulator.
